blocks.text: Now it has already been proved that for a certain number of observations are taken.

blocks.description: A derived expression to estimate a value based on observations.
A calculation of the average based on the sum of squared observations.

blocks.text: Also we have previously stated that the sum of the squares of the actual errors differs very little from the sum of the residual errors; this being true if a great number of observations are taken. Therefore the difference in the two sums may be expressed rather more accurately by the relation.

blocks.description: An equation for calculating residual errors.
A derived average value based on residual calculations.

blocks.text: And applying these results to Example 1 on p. 377.
